issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: The containersKilled metrics is not updated when the container is killed during localization. We should add KILLING state in finished of ContainerImpl.java to update killedContainer.
fields.summary: containersKilled metrics is not updated when the container is killed during localization

comments.body: I uploaded a patch YARN-2675.000.patch for review.

{color:green}+1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12681258/YARN-2675.001.patch
  against trunk revision e073b61.

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  There were no new javadoc warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:green}+1 core tests{color}.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager.

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-YARN-Build/5837//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-YARN-Build/5837//console

This message is automatically generated.

Minor: In ContainerImpl finished, it may be good to add a default case for which we log an error saying "unexpected state encountered, metrics may not be updated correctly" to catch issues like this in future
Otherwise LGTM.

Hi [~adhoot],
 Good suggestion. I uploaded a new patch YARN-2675.002.patch to address your comment.
thanks
zhihai

{color:green}+1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12681673/YARN-2675.002.patch
  against trunk revision 1925e2a.

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

    {color:green}+1 core tests{color}.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager.

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-YARN-Build/5858//console

This message is automatically generated.

I admit it's not caused by your patch, but the fact that we have to catch 'default' and log error without any action tells me this is broken.

I think we should dismantle the finished() method altogether and directly have separate transitions which sub-class ContainerDoneTransition and do the right thing w.r.t metrics for that specific transition. Can we do that here?

Hi [~vinodkv],

thanks for the review. Good suggestion. the new patch YARN-2675.003.patch addressed your comment.
Could you review it?
thanks
zhihai

Hi [~vinodkv],

  Are you ok with the new patch? The new patch passed Hadoop QA test.

thanks
zhihai
Can we add unit tests to exercise all the newly added transitions? Otherwise, the patch looks good. [~vinodkv] - do the changes look okay to you as well?

Hi [~kasha],

Good suggestion, I added unit tests to exercise all the newly added transitions in the new patch YARN-2675.004.patch.

thanks
zhihai

Given we split up all the cases of ContainerDoneTransition, do we still need it?
Although we don't use it in the state machine directly, it is the base class of all other added classes. So we still need it.

bq. it is the base class of all other added classes
Never mind, I am not the brightest today. Forgot the child classes call super.transition.

The latest patch looks good, the findbugs warnings look unrelated.

+1. Checking this in.
Thanks for fixing this, Zhihai. Just committed to trunk and branch-2.
